text: hi everyone Anthony Fantino here
internets busiest music nerd and it's
time for you review the new modern life
is war album fever hunting modern life
is war as an Iowa rock band and their
music fit into a pretty huge trend that
dominated hardcore music about ten years
ago around that time there was a
mountain of different bands that were
approaching hardcore punk music with a
much more melodic edge and when I say
melodic I don't necessarily mean the
kind of clean vocally sung and kind of
accessible poppier choruses that that
were brought to the table by bands like
that religion or propoganda or ignite as
good as those bands are not really the
direction I'm talking about I'm talking
more through harmonious guitar chords
really slow and anthemic lead guitars or
solos like most hardcore punk music
intensity still played a vital role in
the records that we're talking about
here from modern life is war and these
other bands but this intensity played
out and more of a dramatic some would
say melodramatic way than it did just an
outright aggressive one things were a
bit more subtle darker emotionally
dismal groups like life long tragedy and
ruin her and have heart killing the
dream and and more than life took a
similar approach as well it hasn't been
that long since modern life is wort
disbanded they disbanded after their
third full-length LP however it almost
feels like an eternity when you consider
how fast the musical trend they survived
in grew and sort of dissipated however
not to crap on the efforts of a band
like modern life is war or their legacy
because I feel like what happened ten
years ago in hardcore music was a
necessary step to a lot of the very dark
dismal heavy and melodic hardcore
influenced music that we're hearing
today especially when you consider that
heavier and darker is exactly how they
left us on their last full-length album
before they disbanded her sort of went
on this hiatus but there are a few
surprises with this LP for one this
album not as heavy as their last
full-length it seems almost as if
they've abandoned that idea of being a
heavier band and have gone back to just
sort of a more dynamic sound and also I
would say the other surprise with this
LP is that it doesn't really sound like
modern life is war ever stopped making
music I know from the ALF years in
between albums isn't an immense amount
of time but still considering that they
disbanded for a moment and now our back
it's like they never even skipped a beat
really the vocals are as impassioned as
ever the guitars sound really melodic
the drums have a nice intensity to them
really propel the songs I feel like
maybe there's a little bit more dynamics
to modern life as war instrumentally
honestly I see them having more in
common with groups like Touche amor or
La Dispute at this point now as far as
the tunes on this LP go when the
instrumentation I feel like modern life
is war has really delivered they're
doing what they usually do just as well
as they've ever done it and I've done it
and I love the driving bass in the
shrill guitar chords on the track health
wealth and peace just an example of how
with simplicity modern life is work and
pulled together these really captivating
punk anthems anthemic again is just
another word I keep using on these
tracks like the anthemic descending
guitar chords on the second half of the
track chasing my tail just about this
epic and it's just huge and as ambitious
as you can expect a really rough heavy
and intense just frothing at the mouth
punk song to be and the very slow-moving
guitar peji us on tracks like blind or
breeding are just another example of how
a band like modern life is war feels
more sad and moody in their punk
aesthetic than they are aggressive the
title track on here is a really pretty
and sinister stick in my head melody
that I dig and the song dark water has a
kind of bluesy characteristic to the
riff that they play throughout this song
which is not completely surprising
considering that this same band had a
really interesting take on these songs
Stagg early on their last full-length if
there is a weakness on this LP for me
it's really kind of lyrically I feel
like on this album maybe more than other
modern life is where LP is the lyrics
are a little too repetitive or don't
fully explore some of the topics that I
feel like are being addressed here I
almost feel as if tracks like media [ __ ]
for example which is a great song with
fantastic guitars really pumps me up but
the refrain on this thing could really
have been I don't know shortened and
then the extra space could have been
used to bring together some verses or
just another part of the refrain that
would have been memorable or would have
sort of talked more in depth about what
exactly the song is trying to highlight
same goes for old fears new frontiers or
brothers-in-arms forever and there are
other points on this LP where I feel
like where for example we're talking
about time slipping away friends
slipping away and even though I am
saddened by the idea of this I think
with age I've kind of just grown okay
with this fact and we're not really that
upset by it things change however groups
like Lotte dispute for example are able
to take things like letters being sent
to you but coming less and less and
being stranded in your hometown and sort
of taking all these specifics and
turning it into a poem that I think for
even somebody who isn't directly
connected with that emotion or feeling
that way can just it rushes back you
know feels powerful still having said
all of that I think that modern life is
war has pulled together a really good
comeback record and if you're looking
for a punk album that has a lot of
passion has a lot of melody and has
again some anthemic and memorable songs
do give this thing a listen I'm feeling
a light too decent seven on this LP if
you've given it a listen what did you
think of it did you love it hate it why
what do you think I should review next
and that's it this review is my opinion
if you don't like it here's a straw I
want to give a shout out to absol and I
want to give a shout out to the dude who
made a mad video response to my tech 9
review we disagree but you're still a
cool dude I like you man only the strong
subscribe all mistakes were intentional

modern light is war forever
